item.title: AgriTech in Egypt.
item.description:
British Council Newton Fund Â£250k. AgriTech for Egypt - Exploring the application of NLP and Image Processing for an effective decision support system to enhance farmers’ decision-making, their routine agricultural practices and prevention actions. Co-PI leading the Machine Learning research and development.

We partner with the Egyptian Ministry of Agriculture and Al-Fayoum Universty.

item.title: Ph.D. Projects â€” Funding from GE Aviation and UWE. - [PI ~Â£250k].
item.description:
PETER MAYHEW (funded by GE AVIATION) works on “a new framework to identify a common multilevel structure (event inter-dependency) of maintenance repairs to allow the prediction of the repair outcome of electronic components in avionics. Peter is developing a new framework, MARCONI (eMbeddings frAmework foR Classification Of avioNic repaIrs) based on Word2Vec for a word embedding to model the semantics in language sequence and events recorded in the maintenance records.

RYAN FELLOWS (funded by ITS and CATE) works on conversational agents; the Task-oriented Dialogue Systems or chatobs in particular. His research focuses on examining and evaluating the sensitivity of TODS (task-oriented dialogue systems / chatbots) performance to conversational quality attributes, and exploring methods to steer their performance on the basis of optimising attributesâ€™ temporal variability in dialogue.

.
